title.native: 白猫プロジェクトZERO CHRONICLE

description:
The war between the Kingdoms of Light and Dark has raged on since time began. But the new Prince of Darkness is destined to change that.

In the wake of a monster attack, an elderly noble confronts the lone surviving boy. Impressed, he chooses the boy to become his heir to the Throne of Darkness. Meanwhile, in the iridescent clouds above, the Queen of Light and her army are at war with the monsters. But the new Prince of Darkness realizes that Light and Dark must unite and destroy the evil if the world is to survive.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Heterosexual

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

node.description:
**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)

**Birthplace:** North Carolina, US

__[Website](https://www.yasudarei.net/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yasudarei/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasudarei) [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/yasudareiofficial)__

__Rei Yasuda__ is a Japanese-American born vocalist and lyricist under record label SME Records (2013–). She made her initial debut in July 2013 with the single Best of my Love.
5th Anisong Grand Prix Finalist with Konomi Suzuki. As Asuka Ookura, she performed Sakurasou no Pet na Kanojo ED2 "Prime Number" on February 2013.

__[Website](http://www.tm-revolution.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TMR15) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/takanori9nishikawa/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tmrevolutionofficial)__

Takanori Nishikawa is a Japanese voice actor, vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger, who made his debut in the name of T.M.Revolution (T.M.R.) in May 1996, with a single “Dokusai –monopolize-”. Since then, he has established a reputation as a singer with ear-catching tunes, intriguing, irresistible and perfect stage setting and live performances. Many singles have been picked up for theme of major animations and games including “Mobile Suit Gundam”, and “Sengoku BASARA”. Since debut, T.M.R. has built global fan base and reputation mainly among Japanimation fans. He has performed at major anime conventions in the US, such as OTAKON 2003 (@ Baltimore, MD, August 2003), Pacific Media Expo (@ Anaheim, CA and other cities, May 2004) and the local audience were dazzled by his dynamic performance. 

These activities led to his release of albums worldwide. T.M.R. launched his 10th anniversary project in 2005. He released single “vestige” in August 2005 charting No.1 on Oricon chart (Japanese version of Billboard) and released a self-cover album “UNDER:COVER” (all songs are requested by fans) in January 2006. In June, he released a CD and a DVD, both entitled “1000000000000”(pronounced billion) featuring all singles and music videos he had released until then and ranked NO.1 on Oricon chart. Also, T.M.R. went back to the US by appearing on stage for New York Comic Convention, the largest pop culture convention on April 19th 2008 in NYC. On September 19th 2012, T.M.R. released DVD and Blu-ray disc “T.M.R. LIVE REVOLUTION '12 -15th Anniversary FINAL-” which contains footage of 15th anniversary tour final at Daiichi-Taiikukan, National Yoyogi Stadium in Tokyo. On September 2012, he organized a huge open-air rock festival “Inazuma Rock Festival” for the fourth time in his birth place Shiga prefecture. He will be participating “Anime Festival Asia 2012” in Singapore in November. He’s currently expanding his field as an actor, voice actor, and host for a media program.

(Source: tm-revolution.com)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Arataki Itto - Genshin Impact (VG)

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/nocty-x-rucca/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizoguchi_rucca)__

__Birthplace:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Takanori Mizoguchi, alternatively known by stage name RUCCA, is a Japanese lyricist and novelist. 

__Trivia:__
- He uses the name Mizoguchi Takanori (溝口貴紀) mainly when providing material to artists and idols.
- The name RUCCA is mainly used when providing material to the animation and games industry, but was also used once during a special occasion.
- The name L(R)UCCA) used mainly in context, or relation to record label _pure: infinity_, where he provides material for four-piece rock band 100% FREE
- The last name 溝口RUCCA is used as his pen-name when writing novels.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%BA%9D%E5%8F%A3%E8%B2%B4%E7%B4%80), edited)

Daisuke Kikuta is a Japanese music composer and arranger.

He is employed at Aria Entertainment and belongs to Elements Garden.

Daisuke Kikuta is a Japanese music composer and arranger.

He is employed at Aria Entertainment and belongs to Elements Garden.

__Height:__ 155 cm

[Website](http://king-cr.jp/artist/horie/) | [Profile](https://www.vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=8) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/horieyui-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/horieyui_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuihorie_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yui_Horie) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A0%80%E6%B1%9F%E7%94%B1%E8%A1%A3) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/4000.html) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/YuiHorieJP)

She is a voice actress and singer currently affiliated with vims. She hosts a radio show called "Horie Yui no Tenshi no Tamago" (堀江由衣の天使のたまご "Yui Horie's Angel Eggs") and is the founding member of the singing group, Aice5. She is also a member of the band Kurobara Hozonkai, with the name YUIEL. Her hobbies include shoulder massaging, reading and eating. She has been affectionately nicknamed "Hocchan" (ほっちゃん) by her Japanese fans.

**Non-anime roles:** 
- Faruzan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Freesia - Memento Mori (VG)
- Miranda - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Maiden - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Wagon - Ressha Sentai ToQger (Tokusatsu)
- Mine Aomori - Blue Archive (VG)
- Cotton Cookie - Cookie Run: Kingdom (VG)
- Surtr - Arknights (VG)
- Ai-chan - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Charlotte Corday - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
